investopedia.com/2015/04/how-is-the-risk.title: How is the risk-free rate of interest used to calculate other types of...
investopedia.com/2015/04/how-is-the-risk.snippet: The risk-free rate for bonds is used for pricing the yield spread as the difference between the interest rate on a bond and the risk-free rate. For loans, the risk premium is the interest rate banks charge their customers minus the risk-free rate.
